snippet: Mitt Romney on Friday toured hurricane-ravaged regions of Louisiana, a visit that seemed intended to convey an unmistakable air of presidential authority.
abstract: Mitt Romney tours hurricane-ravaged regions of the Louisiana bayou on the first day after formally accepting his party's nomination for president; visit, in which Romney met with Republican Gov Bobby Jindal, appears intended to convey an unmistakable air of presidential authority.

byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel contributed reporting from New Orleans, and Jackie Calmes from Fort Worth.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney on Friday toured hurricane-ravaged regions of Louisiana, a visit that seemed intended to convey an unmistakable air of presidential authority.

headline.main: Romney Shows Support in Storm-Battered Bayou
headline.print_headline: Romney Shows Support In Storm-Battered Bayou
